name: Hotel Imperiale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. On a tree lined street walking distance to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Quiet rooms, nicely furnished. Staff was very helpfull. Breakfast was just standard but who goes for that! Several good small resturants with in a few steps.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an initial disappointment when we arrived at this hotel. The receptionist basically lied to us, she initially said they had overbooked then said they had a hydraulics problem which affected an entire floor of the hotel and some patrons (including myself and my husband) had to go to another hotel for one night. Ok, they paid for the taxi to and from the other hotel, but it meant we couldn't just unpack and settle in for a further day. The other hotel was also not situated in the city centre. When we did return the older man at reception told us "they had overbooked and too many people used the computer, not the way to work". That said, it was a lovely hotel in an ideal location for exploring the city centre. The Metro was nearby and there were plenty of restaurants to choose from. They did compensate for the inconvenience of us having to go to another hotel and gave us a junior suite with a jacuzzi which was spacious and comforatble. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was fine, it could have been better but we thought it was fine, there was plenty of it and just what you would expect for a continental breakfast. We enjoyed our stay very much, apart from having to move initially. Great location.
reviews.title: Unprofessional hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Imperiale on the second leg of our honeymoon. The location was fine - just 5 mins from the nearest Metro and walking dstance to Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain. The hotel itself was not so good. The room was barely ten feet square, with not enough space to have both cases open at same time and the cold buffet breakfast was terrible - even the orange juice wasn't fresh. So when in Rome, find the Imperiale, and then stay at one of it's many neighbours.
reviews.title: Don't take the cat...

reviews.text: We had a four night stay in August at Hotel Imperiale. Before arriving I had requested a quiet room away from the front of the hotel by email. However we were given a very small and noisy room at the front of the hotel. Having complained to the staff they organised for us to be moved the next day, we could not be moved that night as there were lots of teenage students staying that night. The room we were moved to was ideal and the air conditioning and jacussi were ideal in the August heat. The staff were always friendly and very helpful. The location is excellent, close to the metro and bus stops. Very near the trevi fountain and spanish steps. There are several good restuarants in the vicinity, from posh eateries to cheap places for lunch. Definatley would not recommend the hotel restuarant, it was overpriced for the quality of the food, in comparison to others nearby. Overall an excellent hotel and very good staff, would highly recommend
reviews.title: Great Location and Great Price

reviews.text: Just got back from a three night stay at Hotel Imperiale. Location is absolutely terrific - convenient to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, shopping, restaurants, metro and bus lines. Price was reasonable at less than 200E per night for prime location. Rooms were clean, comfortable, quiet and a good size. Found the staff to be friendly and extremely helpful in changing room arrangements and helping us plan special activities for the family. All in all, we found this a great value.
reviews.title: Great location, reasonable price, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking forward to staying at the imperiale as we paid £120 a night and stayed for 3 nights. When we got there, the hotel is in a prime location being on Via Veneto which we were presently suprised about as its only a 5 minute walk to the spanish steps and then you have everything near to you.
reviews.title: Over Priced, Dingy, Rude Staff but good location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very rude and treated us like a number, not a person! They are obviously very busy all the time but we would not recommend this hotel as the room was so small (for british standards!) and we coulds not even fit our suitcase in the room, it had to go on top of the wardrobe!
reviews.title: post Christmas break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Avoid at all costs and pay the extra to stay somewhere off Via Veneto as this hotel is rubbish!
reviews.title: Traditional Style Hote in Good Positionl

likes.disliked: — breakfast room reception and bar/lounge area

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights arriving Boxing Day.We had stayed at this hotel before(5 years ago) and had been impressed.We requested the same room but on arrival were told that it was not available.We were given a very small room overlooking the Via Veneto.Apart from the room size we were happy - clean, nicely furnished, jacuzzi bath.Road noise did not bother us at all due to electronic shutters, double glazing etc.Heavy double doors to corridor meant we heard no guest noise either - good considering the hotel appeared to be full. Many people have commented on the standard of breakfast. We agree with those who give it a poor rating.We have stayed in many 4 star hotels across Europe and the Imperiale offering is one of the poorest.The orange juice was incredibly sweet cordial, there was only one salt pot for the entire restaurant leading to the farcical situation of the waiter spending most of his time wandering round tables looking for it! Although there were several waiters on duty they failed to notice when things needed replenishing.Having said that, breakfast is not the reason for visiting this magnificent city and the Imperiale is extremely well placed for sightseeing . This outweighs any negatives and we would stay here on a return visit. Avoid the gazebo restaurant belonging to the Imperiale -food very average and expensive. Try the restaurant by the metro station( turn right out of hotel 30 seconds walk) where you can watch the chef cooking pizzas through a large window .Pizzas excellent ,steak one of best we've had anywhere.
reviews.title: Great Location, Mediocre Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very traditional style hotel . Situated well for visiting sights particularly Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps.
reviews.title: Great location, poor hotel

reviews.text: My Husband & I booked Hotel Imperiale for our honeymoon. It wasn't quite the 4star hotel we expected in that it was pretty standard with no frills. Room was v.clean but small. The hotel was fitting a new carpet on our floor and we were asked to change rooms after only 2 nights with no compensation offered, which is a bit of a pain when you've unpacked and settled. Saying that, the Hotel is in a great location. The Tour Bus pick up is just outside the front door and the Spanish Steps/Trevis Fountain no more than 10 mins walking distance. The reception/porter staff were v.friendly and the buffet breakfast v.good. They offered a reduced price in August so all in all, great value for money and a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Great Location, Average Hotel
Location-location-location
reviews.text: Our arrival was early morning, before room was ready. Helpful staff placed luggage in locked room while we walked to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The 110 bus stops right across street from hotel. The 110 is a great way for overview of city, with English speaking headphones to point out major attrractions as it circles the city. Room was charming, comfortable, quiet. Staff was very friendly and efficient; good breakfast, and overall, was good value for the price.
hotel imperiale has great location for sight seeing of rome. its postion allow us to take a nap each noon, in order to refresh for second course of rome at afternoon and evening.
reviews.title: location is great

reviews.text: staff were very kind and helpful, they arraged early check-in, taxis, directions, and quick answers by email before our stay. the hotel public areas and the room were very clean and very fresh scented. our room (104) was large enough, but bathroom small (no bath, just congested shower). another con is that room was facing street, so a little bit noisy (also can hear noise from adjacent room). would surely stay there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!!!

reviews.text: Not sure why some people didn't like this hotel. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was very nice. Location was great to catch a bus or the metro. Plenty of restaurants and cafes within walking distance. Really couldn't have asked for better.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay !

reviews.text: Forgot to write review from last year when we stayed here. Booked again as we were impressed by location and the helpful friendly staff. All were still there- surprising for such a central hotel. Nothing too much trouble and whilst the bathroom was small, on holiday you don't spend very much time in your room. Yes some noise but hardly suprising given its ideal location; you expect noise and comings and goings in Capital City Hotels.
reviews.title: Same helpful staff as last year

reviews.text: Breakfast Ok and Pavement restaurant we found delightful albeit so much choice around.
reviews.title: CAN DO BETTER
A complete waste of time
reviews.text: Fitness suite being installed in basement- no work took place at unsuitable hours.

reviews.title: Great location - overall really nice!
reviews.text: Would go again

We were wanting a good 4 star hotel for 4 nights in Rome. This hotel was selected as it was on British Airways recommended list. We did not do any further homework on checking out the hotel which was a mistake.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

description: Hotel set in a restored building dating from 1700 with modern amenities, breakfast room, multilingual staff, excellent location.
